thread.title: Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood: Anton Du Beke is wasting an opportunity
thread.title_full: Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood: Anton Du Beke is wasting an opportunity

title: Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood: Anton Du Beke is wasting an opportunity
text:
Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood: Anton Du Beke is wasting an opportunity Strictly judge Craig Revel Horwood: Anton Du Beke is wasting an opportunity 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Anton Du Beke and Katie Derham may have Viennese Waltzed their way to the top of the leader board at the weekend, but Craig Revel Horwood has blasted Anton for not giving his partner the right material. 
The Strictly Come Dancing judge, 50, stated that the duo are running the risk of losing the competition unless the choreography is improved. Anton and Katie (Guy Levy/BBC) 
Speaking to Woman magazine, Craig said: “Katie is fantastic – but Anton’s got a problem, because he just isn’t giving her the right material and he’s wasting an opportunity. 
“The pro dancers aren’t invincible, but sometimes they think they are. Anton’s not used to being criticised, and he was rather deflated when we told him off for his cha-cha-cha routine.” Strictly Come Dancing judges Len Goodman, Darcey Bussell, Craig Revel Horwood, Bruno Tonioli (Ray Burmiston/BBC) 
The cha-cha-cha routine was the couple’s lowest-scoring, with just 20 points. But at the weekend they beat favourites including Peter Andre, Helen George and Jay McGuinness to score 33 points. 
Their dance was praised by the judges for being “gracious and sophisticated”, while Craig said they were “fantastic”. Catching up with all your AMAZING tweets about last night! I think this photo sums up how we felt! @TheAntonDuBeke pic.twitter.com/IKoJm8Y9dq 
— Katie Derham (@thekatiederham) October 18, 2015 
But according to Digital Spy, Craig told the magazine: “He’s known as the comedy man so to see him enter the competition for real is new — and that does put the pressure on him. He needs to rise to the occasion and get a different game plan.” Share article 
Strictly Come Dancing continues on Saturday October 24 at 6.35pm on BBC One. Promoted Stories
